description: Number of orbits of length n under the full 15-shift (whose periodic points are counted by A001024).
references: Yash Puri and Thomas Ward, A dynamical property unique to the Lucas sequence, Fibonacci Quarterly, Volume 39, Number 5 (November 2001), pp. 398-402.
links: Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
formula: If b(n) is the (n+1)-th term of A001024, then the n-th term is a(n) = (1/n)* Sum_{d|n}\mu(d)b(n/d)
example: a(2)=105 since there are 225 points of period 2 in the full 15-shift and 15 fixed points, so there must be (225-15)/2 = 105 orbits of length 2.
author: Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Mar 21 2001
